title: Damien Tussac
text:
Damien Tussac (born 2 January 1988) is a <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for <a href="Castres%20Olympique">Castres Olympique</a> in the <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a> and the <a href="German%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">German national rugby union team</a>. He is a French citizen but qualifies to play for Germany because of a German grandmother.
Tussac made his debut for Germany against Georgia on 7 February 2009.
He played junior rugby for <a href="La%20Valette-du-Var">La Valette-du-Var</a>, <a href="Stade%20Toulousain">Stade Toulousain</a> and <a href="SC%20Albi">SC Albi</a> before joining RC Toulonnais in 2008. In the 2009–10 season, he has made appearances for the club in league and <a href="European%20Challenge%20Cup">European Challenge Cup</a> matches, but is still part of the club's under-21 team.
He signed a contract with Toulon in effect to December 2009.
Tussac made his debut for the senior team of RC Toulonnais in 2010–11 in a 43–12 win on 23 April 2011 against <a href="USA%20Perpignan">USA Perpignan</a>. He also appeared once in the <a href="Heineken%20Cup">Heineken Cup</a>, against the same team and in the same month, but then in an away defeat.
For the 2012–13 season he joint <a href="Leeds%20Carnegie">Leeds Carnegie</a>, playing in the <a href="RFU%20Championship">RFU Championship</a>.
